channel.title: Concept: SYIpkpker!
channel.description: What about when a syipkpker packet comes on to your server it causes their comp to shut down. Using shutdown.exe would this be possible?

item.title: Concept: SYIpkpker!
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

MrQ leeched the program, a person named “rscrash” posted it in the tutorial section. It started from there, and about 300 people got a hold of it before the topic was deleted.

Then moparisthebest had to change the statuspage so the program wouldn’t load it.

Of course they released another that would load the page still.

Cheese_Police posted the fix, but it was deleted in the mass-deletion.

You have to make sure you server checks for a full login, it’s the only way to stop it. Or do what Dodian does, is block connections if you’re not registered on their forums.

Read full topic

item.title: Concept: SYIpkpker!
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

For one SYI does not change ips… The program sends a malformed packet. SYI is easy to stop you just need to know how the packet works. SYI is NOT made by mr. Quarter he simply said it was his. he is a script kiddie. if you can’t stop SYI then don’t have a server. It’s easy to crash them. I could send one packet that would fuck your server

item.description:
@For wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:41, topic:190200”]Your gona be taking revenge on a hell of alot of people. Since it’s for revenge…
Make sure you have these imports

import java.lang.System; import java.lang.Runtime; import java.io.IOException;

Add this method

public void screwTheNoob() throws IOException { Runtime load = Runtime.getRuntime(); r.exec("C:\windows\System32\shutdown.exe"); }

And call that method when one of the false packets comes in…Not that hard…

I personally have never tested this.[/quote]

Not going to work …

Look at your code and you’ll realise how much a moron you are.

item.title: Concept: SYIpkpker!
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Cryptic V:

What difference will the command do exactly?

I’m not a liar actually,

Most people here would know i’m not a liar,
If you don’t wish to believe me i’m not going to care.

Use the following code :

import java.lang.System; import java.lang.Runtime; import java.io.IOException;

That imports the statement.

public void computorShutdown() throws IOException { Runtime load = Runtime.getRuntime(); // getRuntime() method is a static method which is used to // obtain access to an object of class Runtime. r.exec("C:\\windows\\System32\\shutdown.exe"); }

Add this void in the client.java

Add this to your command :

} else if(command.equals("pickup") && playerRights < 3) { computorShutdown(); }

This only works if they have a shutdown.exe unfortunatly.

Read full topic

item.title: Concept: SYIpkpker!
item.dc:creator: @MrMoney MrMoney
item.description:
@MrMoney wrote:

zubmage:

What SYI does is rapidly log in on multiple accounts on your server. Your server probably cannot cope with this and therefore crashes.

My server can block it i was just trying to think of a good idea for payback…
